text.div:
<!-- Resources -->
<!-- StructuredDataCaptureElement -->
<DataElement xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">
 <!-- from Element: extension -->
 <!--"meaning":   -->
 <extension><!-- 0..1 @ttp://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/datelement-11179#meaning Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
 <!--"minLength":   -->
 <extension><!-- 0..1 @ttp://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/element-constraints#minLength Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
 <!--"maxLength":   -->
 <extension><!-- 0..1 @ttp://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/element-constraints#maxLength Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
 <!--"regex":   -->
 <extension><!-- 0..1 @ttp://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/element-constraints#regex Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
 <!--"entryFormat":   -->
 <extension><!-- 0..1 @ttp://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/element-constraints#entryFormat Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
 <!--"minValue":   -->
 <extension><!-- 0..1 @ttp://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/element-constraints#minValue Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
 <!--"maxValue":   -->
 <extension><!-- 0..1 @ttp://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/element-constraints#maxValue Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
 <!--"maxDecimalPlaces":   -->
 <extension><!-- 0..1 @ttp://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/element-constraints#maxDecimalPlaces Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
 <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
 <text><!-- 0..1 Narrative Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation --></text>
 <contained><!-- 0..* Resource Contained, inline Resources --></contained>
 <identifier value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Logical id to reference this data element -->
 <version value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Logical id for this version of the data element -->
 <publisher value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Name of the publisher (Organization or individual) -->
 <telecom><!-- 0..* Contact Contact information of the publisher --></telecom>
 <status value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 draft | active | retired -->
 <date value="[dateTime]"/><!-- 0..1 Date for this version of the data element -->
 <name value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Descriptive label for this element definition -->
 <category><!-- 0..* CodeableConcept Assist with indexing and finding --></category>
 <code><!-- 0..* Coding Identifying concept --></code>
 <question value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 How to ask for element -->
 <definition value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Full formal definition in human language -->
 <comments value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Comments about the use of this element -->
 <requirements value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Why is this needed? -->
 <synonym value="[string]"/><!-- 0..* Other names -->
 <type value="[code]"/><!-- 1..1 Name of Data type -->
 <example[x]><!-- 0..1 * Example value: [as defined for type] --></example[x]>
 <maxLength value="[integer]"/><!-- 0..1 Length for strings -->
 <units><!-- 0..1 CodeableConcept Units to use for measured value --></units>
 <binding>  <!-- 0..1 ValueSet details if this is coded -->
  <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
  <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
  <isExtensible value="[boolean]"/><!-- 1..1 Can additional codes be used? -->
  <conformance value="[code]"/><!-- 0..1 required | preferred | example -->
  <description value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Human explanation of the value set -->
  <valueSet><!-- 1..1 Resource(ValueSet) Source of value set --></valueSet>
 </binding>
 <!--"ClassPropertyMapping":   -->
 <mapping>  <!-- 0..1 Map element to another set of definitions -->
  <extension><!-- 0..* Extension Additional Content defined by implementations --></extension>
  <modifierExtension><!-- 0..* Extension Extensions that cannot be ignored --></modifierExtension>
  <uri value="[uri]"/><!-- 1..1 Identifies what this mapping refers to -->
  <name value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Names what this mapping refers to -->
  <comments value="[string]"/><!-- 0..1 Versions, Issues, Scope limitations etc -->
  <map value="[string]"/><!-- 1..1 Details of the mapping -->
 </mapping>
 <!--"objectClass":   -->
 <extension>  1..1 @ttp://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/datelement-11179#objectClass  <!--  1..1 Additional Content defined by implementations -->
  <valueCoding><!-- 1..1 Coding Value of extension --></valueCoding>
 </extension>
 <!--"property":   -->
 <extension>  1..1 @ttp://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/datelement-11179#property  <!--  1..1 Additional Content defined by implementations -->
  <valueCoding><!-- 1..1 Coding Value of extension --></valueCoding>
 </extension>
</DataElement>

name: Structured Data Capture Data Element
publisher: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)
description: Sets expectations for data elements registered or used as part of the structured data capture project

definition.formal: Resource data element.
definition.comments: Often called a clinical template.

definition.formal: Additional Content defined by implementations.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.short: Logical id to reference this data element
definition.formal: Logical id to reference this data element.
definition.comments: N/A.

definition.short: Logical id for this version of the data element
definition.formal: Logical id for this version of the data element.
definition.comments: N/A.

definition.short: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)
definition.formal: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual).
definition.comments: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

definition.formal: Contact information of the publisher.
definition.comments: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number (tel:), etc.

definition.formal: draft | active | retired.

binding.name: ResourceDataElementStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of a Resource data element

definition.short: Date for this version of the data element
definition.formal: Date for this version of the data element.

definition.short: Descriptive label for this element definition
definition.formal: Descriptive label for this element definition.
Assist with indexing and finding.
Identifying concept.
How to ask for element.

definition.short: Full formal definition in human language
definition.formal: Full formal definition in human language.

definition.short: Comments about the use of this element
definition.formal: Comments about the use of this element.
definition.comments: If it is possible to capture usage rules using invariants, that mechanism should be used in preference to this element.

definition.formal: Why is this needed?.
Other names.
Name of Data type.

binding.name: DataType
binding.description: The type of an element - one of the FHIR data types

definition.formal: Example value: [as defined for type].
Length for strings.
definition.comments: If not specified, there is no conformance expectation for length support.

definition.short: Units to use for measured value
definition.formal: Units to use for measured value.

binding.name: Units
binding.description: Type of measurement system used to express a value

definition.short: ValueSet details if this is coded
definition.formal: ValueSet details if this is coded.

definition.formal: Can additional codes be used?.
definition.comments: When the binding use used for elements with a type of "code" (rather than Coding or CodableConcept), the binding is treated as non-extensible regardless of the value of this property.

definition.formal: required | preferred | example.

definition.short: Human explanation of the value set
definition.formal: Human explanation of the value set.
Source of value set.
definition.comments: The display can contain the value set description.  The reference may be version-specific or not.

definition.short: Map element to another set of definitions
definition.formal: Map element to another set of definitions.
definition.comments: Mappings are not necessarily specific enough for safe translation.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.short: Identifies what this mapping refers to
definition.formal: Identifies what this mapping refers to.
definition.comments: A formal identity for the specification being mapped to helps with identifying maps consistently.

definition.short: Names what this mapping refers to
definition.formal: Names what this mapping refers to.
Versions, Issues, Scope limitations etc.
This should be expressed as "[uri for object class code system]#[code for object class code system] | [uri for property code system]#[code for property code system]".
definition.comments: We express the mapping even though the class and property extensions already convey the data to ensure that systems that don't recongnize the extensions still understand the mappings.
